content.p: A {{weight}} pound weight is suspended in equilibrium by two ropes. The weight is at the point P=({{u1}}, {{u2}}, {{u3}}). The ropes are anchored at points Q=({{v1}}, {{v2}}, {{v3}}) and R=({{w1}}, {{w2}}, {{w3}}). Give vectors \mathbf{F}_1, \mathbf{F}_2 that describe the forces along the ropes.

outtro.p: To achieve equilibrium, we have force vectors \mathbf{F}_1 = \langle {{vec11}}, {{vec12}}, {{vec13}}\rangle, \mathbf{F}_2 = \langle {{vec21}}, {{vec22}}, {{vec23}}\rangle.
